result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demario M Robinson

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:50 AM Defendant Demario M Robinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Demario M Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
There are no victims on this case. 

Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets. 

Court will quash stayed capias.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:12 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant Demario M Robinson not in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Atty in court for Demario M Robinson. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Simon is unsure where his client is today and does not have a global offer as of today. 
Atty Simon requests a capias be stayed until the next hearing date as his client has never missed court. 
State requests warrant to issue and bail revoked and forfeited. 
Court will issue a capias and stay that capias until the next hearing date.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Demario M Robinson
Current: 6537 N Beale St #5, Milwaukee, WI 53224 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2022)
Prior: 6537 N Beale St #5, Milwaukee, WI 53223

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

8:32 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Demario M Robinson in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty appeared by Zoom for Demario M Robinson. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court extends the appointment of attorney Simon to this case.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
